chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
n: nat
x: string nat
y: list bool

Goal:
g_s' (f_s x ++ y) n = match x with | [] => g_s' y n | m :: x => n + m :: x ++ g_s' y 0 end

Premises:
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
f_s = fix f_s (x : string nat) : string bool := match x with | [] => [] | a :: x0 => to_bitstring a ++ [false] ++ f_s x0 end : string nat -> string bool
g_s' = fix g_s' (x : string bool) (n : nat) {struct x} : string nat := match x with | [] => [] | true :: x' => g_s' x' (S n) | false :: x' => n :: g_s' x' 0 end : string bool -> nat -> string nat Arguments g_s' _ _%nat_scope
string = fun X : Type => list X : Type -> Type Arguments string _%type_scope
fresh = fix fresh (l : list nat) : nat := match l with | [] => 0 | x :: l0 => S x + fresh l0 end : list nat -> nat Arguments fresh _%list_scope
ArithRing.nat_morph_N = {| Ring_theory.Smorph0 := eq_refl; Ring_theory.Smorph1 := eq_refl; Ring_theory.Smorph_add := Nnat.N2Nat.inj_add; Ring_theory.Smorph_mul := Nnat.N2Nat.inj_mul; Ring_theory.Smorph_eq := fun (x y : BinNums.N) (H : BinNat.N.eqb x y = true) => let H0 : forall n m : BinNums.N, BinNat.N.eqb n m = true -> n = m := fun n m : BinNums.N => match BinNat.N.eqb_eq n m with | conj x0 _ => x0 end in let H1 : x = y := H0 x y H in eq_ind_r (fun x0 : BinNums.N => BinNat.N.to_nat x0 = BinNat.N.to_nat y) eq_refl H1 |} : Ring_theory.semi_morph 0 1 Nat.add Nat.mul eq BinNums.N...
Nat.sub = fix sub (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => n | S k => match m with | 0 => n | S l => sub k l end end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Nat.sub (_ _)%nat_scope
Nat.max = fix max (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S n' => match m with | 0 => n | S m' => S (max n' m') end end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Nat.max (_ _)%nat_scope
BinIntDef.Z.add = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match x with | BinNums.Z0 => y | BinNums.Zpos x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => x | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.add x' y') | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub x' y' end | BinNums.Zneg x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => x | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub y' x' | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinNums.Zneg (BinPos.Pos.add x' y') end end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.add (_ _)%Z_scope
Nat.mul = fix mul (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | S p => m + mul p m end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Nat.mul (_ _)%nat_scope
RingMicromega.ge_bool = fix ge_bool (n m : nat) {struct n} : bool := match n with | 0 => match m with | 0 => true | S _ => false end | S n0 => match m with | 0 => true | S m0 => ge_bool n0 m0 end end : nat -> nat -> bool Arguments RingMicromega.ge_bool (_ _)%nat_scope
tau2 = fix tau2 (X : Type) (A : stack X) {struct A} : string X := match A with | [] => [] | (_, y) :: A0 => y ++ tau2 X A0 end : forall X : Type, stack X -> string X Arguments tau2 {X}%type_scope
tau1 = fix tau1 (X : Type) (A : stack X) {struct A} : string X := match A with | [] => [] | (x, _) :: A0 => x ++ tau1 X A0 end : forall X : Type, stack X -> string X Arguments tau1 {X}%type_scope
BinNatDef.N.add = fun n m : BinNums.N => match n with | BinNums.N0 => m | BinNums.Npos p => match m with | BinNums.N0 => n | BinNums.Npos q => BinNums.Npos (BinPos.Pos.add p q) end end : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> BinNums.N Arguments BinNatDef.N.add (_ _)%N_scope
f_s_app : forall x y : list nat, f_s (x ++ y) = f_s x ++ f_s y
MPCP = fun '(x, y, P) => exists A : stack nat, A <<= (x, y) :: P /\ x ++ tau1 A = y ++ tau2 A : card nat * stack nat -> Prop
in_elt_inv : forall (A : Type) (x y : A) (l1 l2 : list A), x el l1 ++ y :: l2 -> x = y \/ x el l1 ++ l2
BinNatDef.N.eqb = fun n m : BinNums.N => match n with | BinNums.N0 => match m with | BinNums.N0 => true | BinNums.Npos _ => false end | BinNums.Npos p => match m with | BinNums.N0 => false | BinNums.Npos q => BinPos.Pos.eqb p q end end : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> bool Arguments BinNatDef.N.eqb (_ _)%N_scope
Nat.add = fix add (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S p => S (add p m) end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Nat.add (_ _)%nat_scope
app_cons_not_nil : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A) (a : A), [] <> x ++ a :: y
app_comm_cons : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A) (a : A), a :: x ++ y = (a :: x) ++ y
BinPosDef.Pos.add = with add (x y : BinNums.positive) {struct x} : BinNums.positive := match x with | BinNums.xI p => match y with | BinNums.xI q => BinNums.xO (add_carry p q) | BinNums.xO q => BinNums.xI (add p q) | BinNums.xH => BinNums.xO (BinPosDef.Pos.succ p) end | BinNums.xO p => match y with | BinNums.xI q => BinNums.xI (add p q) | BinNums.xO q => BinNums.xO (add p q) | BinNums.xH => BinNums.xI p end | BinNums.xH => match y with | BinNums.xI q => BinNums.xO (BinPosDef.Pos.succ q) | BinNums.xO q => BinNums.xI q | BinNums.xH => Bin...
BinNatDef.N.mul = fun n m : BinNums.N => match n with | BinNums.N0 => BinNums.N0 | BinNums.Npos p => match m with | BinNums.N0 => BinNums.N0 | BinNums.Npos q => BinNums.Npos (BinPos.Pos.mul p q) end end : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> BinNums.N Arguments BinNatDef.N.mul (_ _)%N_scope
split_inv : forall (X : Type) (u z x y : list X) (s : X), u ++ z = x ++ s :: y -> ~ s el u -> exists x' : list X, x = u ++ x'
BinIntDef.Z.of_nat = fun n : nat => match n with | 0 => BinNums.Z0 | S n0 => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.of_succ_nat n0) end : nat -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.of_nat _%nat_scope
MPCPb = fun '(x, y, P) => exists A : stack bool, A <<= (x, y) :: P /\ x ++ tau1 A = y ++ tau2 A : card bool * stack bool -> Prop
rev_app_distr : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A), rev (x ++ y) = rev y ++ rev x
Inductive derivable (X : Type) (P : stack X) : string X -> string X -> Prop := der_sing : forall x y : list X, (x, y) el P -> derivable P x y | der_cons : forall (x y : list X) (u v : string X), (x, y) el P -> derivable P u v -> derivable P (x ++ u) (y ++ v) Arguments derivable {X}%type_scope Arguments der_sing {X}%type_scope _ (_ _)%list_scope Arguments der_cons {X}%type_scope _ (_ _)%list_scope
f_c = fun '(x, y) => (f_s x, f_s y) : string nat * string nat -> string bool * string bool
seq = fix seq (start len : nat) {struct len} : list nat := match len with | 0 => [] | S len0 => start :: seq (S start) len0 end : nat -> nat -> list nat Arguments seq (_ _)%nat_scope
derivable_sind : forall (X : Type) (P : stack X) (P0 : string X -> string X -> SProp), (forall x y : list X, (x, y) el P -> P0 x y) -> (forall (x y : list X) (u v : string X), (x, y) el P -> derivable P u v -> P0 u v -> P0 (x ++ u) (y ++ v)) -> forall s s0 : string X, derivable P s s0 -> P0 s s0
derivable_ind : forall (X : Type) (P : stack X) (P0 : string X -> string X -> Prop), (forall x y : list X, (x, y) el P -> P0 x y) -> (forall (x y : list X) (u v : string X), (x, y) el P -> derivable P u v -> P0 u v -> P0 (x ++ u) (y ++ v)) -> forall s s0 : string X, derivable P s s0 -> P0 s s0
itau1 = fix itau1 (X : Type) (P : stack X) (A : list nat) {struct A} : string X := match A with | [] => [] | i :: A0 => fst (nth i P ([], [])) ++ itau1 X P A0 end : forall X : Type, stack X -> list nat -> string X Arguments itau1 {X}%type_scope _ _%list_scope
itau2 = fix itau2 (X : Type) (P : stack X) (A : list nat) {struct A} : string X := match A with | [] => [] | i :: A0 => snd (nth i P ([], [])) ++ itau2 X P A0 end : forall X : Type, stack X -> list nat -> string X Arguments itau2 {X}%type_scope _ _%list_scope
